accumRatio(address,address,bytes1,uint32.details: _tokenA and _tokenB may be passed in either tokenA/tokenB or tokenB/tokenA order

params._swapIntervalMask: The byte representation of the swap interval to check
params._tokenB: The other of the pair's token

deposit(address,address,uint256,uint32,u.details: Will revert: With ZeroAddress if _from, _to or _owner are zero With InvalidToken if _from == _to With ZeroAmount if _amount is zero With AmountTooBig if _amount is too big With ZeroSwaps if _amountOfSwaps is zero With IntervalNotAllowed if _swapInterval is not allowed

params._amount: How many "from" tokens will be swapped in total
params._amountOfSwaps: How many swaps to execute for this position
params._owner: The address of the owner of the position being created
params._permissions: Extra permissions to add to the position. Can be empty
params._swapInterval: How frequently the position's swaps should be executed

returns._0: The id of the created position

deposit(address,address,uint256,uint32,u.details: Will revert: With ZeroAddress if _from, _to or _owner are zero With InvalidToken if _from == _to With ZeroAmount if _amount is zero With AmountTooBig if _amount is too big With ZeroSwaps if _amountOfSwaps is zero With IntervalNotAllowed if _swapInterval is not allowed

params._amount: How many "from" tokens will be swapped in total
params._amountOfSwaps: How many swaps to execute for this position
params._miscellaneous: Bytes that will be emitted, and associated with the position
params._owner: The address of the owner of the position being created
params._permissions: Extra permissions to add to the position. Can be empty
params._swapInterval: How frequently the position's swaps should be executed

returns._positionId: The id of the created position

getNextSwapInfo(address[],(uint8,uint8)[.details: Will revert with: With InvalidTokens if _tokens are not sorted, or if there are duplicates With InvalidPairs if _pairs are not sorted (first by indexTokenA and then indexTokenB), or if indexTokenA >= indexTokenB for any pair

params._pairs: The pairs that you want to swap. Each element of the list points to the index of the token in the _tokens array
params._tokens: The tokens involved in the next swap

returns._swapInformation: The information about the next swap

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

increasePosition(uint256,uint256,uint32).details: Will revert: With InvalidPosition if _positionId is invalid With UnauthorizedCaller if the caller doesn't have access to the position With AmountTooBig if _amount is too big

params._amount: Amount of funds to add to the position

loan((address,uint256)[],address,bytes).details: Will revert: With Paused if loans are paused by protocol With InvalidTokens if the tokens in `_loan` are not sorted

params._data: Any data that should be passed through to the callback
params._loan: The amount to borrow in each token
params._to: Address that will receive the loan. This address should be a contract that implements `IDCAPairLoanCallee`

returns._0: Whether swaps and loans are currently paused

reducePosition(uint256,uint256,uint32,ad.details: Will revert: With InvalidPosition if _positionId is invalid With UnauthorizedCaller if the caller doesn't have access to the position With ZeroSwaps if _newSwaps is zero and _amount is not the total unswapped balance

params._amount: Amount of funds to withdraw from the position
params._recipient: The address to send tokens to

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

setLoanFee(uint32).details: Will revert with HighFee if the fee is higher than the maximumWill revert with InvalidFee if the fee is not multiple of 100

setOracle(address).details: Will revert with ZeroAddress if the zero address is passed

setPlatformFeeRatio(uint16).details: Will revert with HighPlatformFeeRatio if given ratio is too high

setSwapFee(uint32).details: Will revert with HighFee if the fee is higher than the maximumWill revert with InvalidFee if the fee is not multiple of 100

swap(address[],(uint8,uint8)[],address,a.details: Will revert with: With InvalidTokens if _tokens are not sorted, or if there are duplicates With InvalidPairs if _pairs are not sorted (first by indexTokenA and then indexTokenB), or if indexTokenA >= indexTokenB for any pair Paused if swaps are paused by protocol NoSwapsToExecute if there are no swaps to execute for the given pairs LiquidityNotReturned if the required tokens were not back during the callback

params._borrow: How much to borrow of each of the tokens in _tokens. The amount must match the position of the token in the _tokens array
params._callbackHandler: Address to call for callback (and send the borrowed tokens to)
params._data: Bytes to send to the caller during the callback
params._pairsToSwap: The pairs that you want to swap. Each element of the list points to the index of the token in the _tokens array
params._rewardRecipient: The address to send the reward to
params._tokens: The tokens involved in the next swap

swapAmountDelta(address,address,bytes1,u.details: _tokenA and _tokenB may be passed in either tokenA/tokenB or tokenB/tokenA order

params._swapIntervalMask: The byte representation of the swap interval to check
params._tokenB: The other of the pair's token

returns._0: How much will the amount to swap differ, when compared to the swap just before this one

swapData(address,address,bytes1).details: _tokenA and _tokenB may be passed in either tokenA/tokenB or tokenB/tokenA order

params._swapIntervalMask: The byte representation of the swap interval to check
params._tokenB: The other of the pair's token

terminate(uint256,address,address).details: Will revert: With InvalidPosition if _positionId is invalid With UnauthorizedCaller if the caller doesn't have access to the position With ZeroAddress if _recipientUnswapped or _recipientSwapped is zero

params._recipientSwapped: The address to withdraw swapped tokens to
params._recipientUnswapped: The address to withdraw unswapped tokens to

params._recipient: The address that will receive the tokens

withdrawSwapped(uint256,address).details: Will revert: With InvalidPosition if _positionId is invalid With UnauthorizedCaller if the caller doesn't have access to the position With ZeroAddress if recipient is zero

params._recipient: The address to withdraw swapped tokens to

withdrawSwappedMany((address,uint256[])[.details: Will revert: With InvalidPosition if any of the position ids are invalid With UnauthorizedCaller if the caller doesn't have access to the position to any of the given positions With ZeroAddress if recipient is zero With PositionDoesNotMatchToken if any of the positions do not match the token in their position set

params._positions: A list positions, grouped by `to` token
params._recipient: The address to withdraw swapped tokens to

returns._swapped: How much was withdrawn for each token

AmountTooBig().notice: Thrown when a user tries create or modify a position with an amount too big

HighFee().notice: Thrown when trying to set a fee higher than the maximum allowed

HighPlatformFeeRatio().notice: Thrown when trying to set a fee ratio that is higher that the maximum allowed

IntervalNotAllowed().notice: Thrown when a user tries to create a position with a swap interval that is not allowed

InvalidFee().notice: Thrown when trying to set a fee that is not multiple of 100

InvalidInterval().notice: Thrown when a user tries convert and invalid interval to a byte representation

InvalidMask().notice: Thrown when a user tries convert and invalid byte representation to an interval

InvalidPairs().notice: Thrown when pairs indexes are not sorted correctly

InvalidPosition().notice: Thrown when a user tries operate on a position that doesn't exist (it might have been already terminated)

InvalidToken().notice: Thrown when a user tries to create a position with the same `from` & `to`

InvalidTokens().notice: Thrown when a list of token pairs is not sorted, or if there are duplicates

LiquidityNotReturned().notice: Thrown when the expected liquidity is not returned, either in flash loans or swaps

NoSwapsToExecute().notice: Thrown when trying to execute a swap, but there is nothing to swap

PositionDoesNotMatchToken().notice: Thrown when a user tries to withdraw a position whose `to` token doesn't match the specified one

UnauthorizedCaller().notice: Thrown when a user tries operate on a position that they don't have access to

ZeroAddress().notice: Thrown when one of the parameters is a zero address

ZeroAmount().notice: Thrown when a user tries to create a position with zero funds

ZeroSwaps().notice: Thrown when a user tries to create a position with zero swaps

Deposited(address,address,uint256,addres.notice: Emitted when a position is created

LoanFeeSet(uint32).notice: Emitted when a new loan fee is set

Loaned(address,address,(address,uint256).notice: Emitted when a flash loan is executed

Miscellaneous(uint256,bytes).notice: Emitted when a position is created and extra data is provided

Modified(address,uint256,uint120,uint32,.notice: Emitted when a position is modified

OracleSet(address).notice: Emitted when a new oracle is set

PlatformFeeRatioSet(uint16).notice: Emitted when a new platform fee ratio is set

SwapFeeSet(uint32).notice: Emitted when a new swap fee is set

SwapIntervalsAllowed(uint32[]).notice: Emitted when new swap intervals are allowed

SwapIntervalsForbidden(uint32[]).notice: Emitted when some swap intervals are no longer allowed

Swapped(address,address,address,((addres.notice: Emitted when a swap is executed

Terminated(address,address,address,uint2.notice: Emitted when a position is terminated

Withdrew(address,address,uint256,address.notice: Emitted when a user withdraws all swapped tokens from a position

WithdrewFromPlatform(address,address,(ad.notice: Emitted when someone withdraws from the paltform balance

WithdrewMany(address,address,(address,ui.notice: Emitted when a user withdraws all swapped tokens from many positions

MAX_FEE().notice: Returns the max fee that can be set for either swap or loans

MAX_PLATFORM_FEE_RATIO().notice: Returns the max fee ratio that can be set

accumRatio(address,address,bytes1,uint32.notice: Returns the sum of the ratios reported in all swaps executed until the given swap number

activeSwapIntervals(address,address).notice: Returns the byte representation of the set of actice swap intervals for the given pair

addSwapIntervalsToAllowedList(uint32[]).notice: Adds new swap intervals to the allowed list

allowedSwapIntervals().notice: Returns a byte that represents allowed swap intervals

getNextSwapInfo(address[],(uint8,uint8)[.notice: Returns all information related to the next swap

increasePosition(uint256,uint256,uint32).notice: Takes the unswapped balance, adds the new deposited funds and modifies the position so that it is executed in _newSwaps swaps

loan((address,uint256)[],address,bytes).notice: Executes a flash loan, sending the required amounts to the specified loan recipient

loanFee().notice: Returns the fee charged on loans

paused().notice: Returns whether swaps and loans are currently paused

platformBalance(address).notice: Returns how much of the hub's token balance belongs to the platform

platformFeeRatio().notice: Returns how much will the platform take from the fees collected in swaps

reducePosition(uint256,uint256,uint32,ad.notice: Withdraws the specified amount from the unswapped balance and modifies the position so that it is executed in _newSwaps swaps

removeSwapIntervalsFromAllowedList(uint3.notice: Removes some swap intervals from the allowed list

setPlatformFeeRatio(uint16).notice: Sets a new platform fee ratio

swapAmountDelta(address,address,bytes1,u.notice: Returns how much will the amount to swap differ from the previous swap. f.e. if the returned value is -100, then the amount to swap will be 100 less than the swap just before it

swapData(address,address,bytes1).notice: Returns swapping information about a specific pair

swapFee().notice: Returns the fee charged on swaps

terminate(uint256,address,address).notice: Terminates the position and sends all unswapped and swapped balance to the specified recipients

withdrawFromPlatformBalance((address,uin.notice: Withdraws tokens from the platform balance

withdrawSwapped(uint256,address).notice: Withdraws all swapped tokens from a position to a recipient

withdrawSwappedMany((address,uint256[])[.notice: Withdraws all swapped tokens from multiple positions

t_mapping(t_address,t_mapping(t_address,.label: mapping(address => mapping(address => mapping(bytes1 => mapping(uint32 => struct IDCAHubParameters.AccumRatio))))
mapping(address => mapping(address => mapping(bytes1 => mapping(uint32 => struct IDCAHubParameters.SwapDelta))))
